  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operation. The UN 1A2 steel drum (Overpack, shrink wrapped on a wooden pallet) fell off of the belt, damaging the top/lid of the drum. Markings and labels on the drum: 19kg, LOT#BA3374SV, UC/61302-7 UVETT Adhesion Primer, EJ Full VOLYM Part Full Container, Overpack XRY/OK/GOT/3227/ 2024-12-10T18:12 The steel drum was placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 12, 2014, one (1) 5-gallon pail of Wheel Acid was punctured and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all released product from the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal. The impacted pallet was dismantled and containerized in one (1) 85-gallon drum,

  • Description: On December 11, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES&H to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all UN1263 from the site. The damaged pails and all impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: Operations Supervisor I Mike Husby contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Mike stated that forklift operator Michael Campbell was removing a pallet from trailer 86161 that was stacked on top of a pallet containing bags of UN3378, Sodium carbonate peroxyhydrate, 5.1, PG II. Mike stated that wo oden pallet had punctured through the cardboard dunnage that was placed between the two pallets. Mike stated that when forklift operator Michael Campbell lifted pallet on top the pallet had snagged one of the bags of UN3378 and when he started to back up it pulled one of the bags out of the shrink w rap. Mike stated that the bag ripped resulting in a spillage of 40-lbs of UN3378 onto the trailer floor.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XNW, experienced a UN1805 pH Down release from a 6-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contactors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to 10 x 10 area of the concrete dock floor. The release occurred due to being crushed. The damaged jug was placed into a 30-gallon poly drum prior to contactors arrival. The crew cleaned the impacted area with soda ash and absorbents. All impacted absorbents and debris were containerized into a 15-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On 12/10 contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6 ounces of product released to a 10 circle around the leg. The release was confirmed to be from a leaking weld/seam on the leg of the tote. The tote was patched, containment was placed around it, and it was staged for future transfer. On 12/11 when the new metal tote arrived onsite, contractors returned to transfer the product from the damaged metal tote into a new one. Each tote was then staged onsite to be returned to the customer. One 55-gallon metal drum of waste was generated containing rinse water from cleaning the hoses and absorbents that were used for the containment. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

SRS properly secured the car by closing the BOV handle and properly tool tightening the secondary closure cap. Approximately 1/2 gallon of product released that impacted the ballast.

The fiberboard box contained six plastic bottles in a plastic bag and the cap was loose on one of the bottles causing the release. The spill agent found a SDS in a packing slip attached to the fiberboard box stating the contents were UN1805 Phosphoric Acid, Solution, 8, III. The shipment was not packaged in UN spec packaging, no DG markings or paperwork required for transport. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and are being held at the location.

  • Description: During an inspection in the Gallup yard, the FRA inspector found SHQX 7254 leaking and producing a white crystallization of the ammonium nitrate liquid around the bottom outlet valve. The HM manager responded and found a less-than-tool-tight BOV cap. There was an approximate 1-cup release to soil. The gasket was intact, but there was a small drip from the ball valve itself. The cap was cleaned, threads were taped, and the cap was tool-tightened, stopping any further release.

  • Description: At 02:54 EST on 11/16, XPO-NOF contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 quart of "RDL 16" from a 50gal metal drum impacting the trailer floor. The drum was discovered damaged due to an unknown cause. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist with the spill as soon as possible. The spill was partially contained by terminal staff using oil-dri. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of RDL 16 product released to a 1 x 1 area of the trailer floor and stain found on area of the dock floor due to improper blocking and bracing. Contractors applied absorbents to minimize staining and containerized the damaged drum inside of 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/13/24 a ODOT Hazmat Inspection was performed on unit ESTU 501187 at destination at the BNSF Portland Intermodal Facility. Per ODOT Inspector Matt McDowell interior inspection showed loaded with 56 pails of UN1263, Paint Related Material, no active leaking could be found as the product was loaded towards the front of the trailer, but the odor was strong. The unit was placed on hold and Republic was dispatched to come and remediate the odor/possible leak. Upon inspection Republic Environmental found a case of palletized paint thinner with a UN 1236 that was over-packed and had leaked within itself, nothing hitting the floor as the boxes absorbed it all. A total of 17 leaking 1 gallon containers were separated and re packaged from the remaining non damaged containers.

item.title: Report E-2024120232
item.description:
Report E-2024120232

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: FARRAGUT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 7, 2024, at 1751 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Farragut, TN regarding the release of BPW 76910 Antifoam. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 0.5 gallons of BPW 76910 Antifoam (UN3082, 9, III) from (1) 330-gallon poly tote onto the trailer floor and asphalt parking lot. The release was reportedly due to a crack in the tote, impacting a 4 x 6 area on the trailer and a 1 x 3 area of asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors transferred the remaining product into a new 330-gallon poly tote to continue on with the clients shipment and took the damaged tote off-site for proper disposal. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM, which was then taken off site by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • Description: At ~1900 hours, a Veolia driver picked up a tanker of DMF and piperidine to move it to a 3rd party transporter yard. The manway cover was not secure allowing liquid to spill from the tanker onto the soil. The Veolia emergency response number was called and EnviroServe was dispatched. EnviroServe estimated the spill affected 2000' X 10' of dirt. The affected soil was collected into roll off dumpsters for disposal. The NRC and CDPHE Emergency Reporting were contacted and Veolia received a call from the City and County of Denver Environmental Quality Duty Officer.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:02 PM ET, XDM contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred at a Fat Dog's truck stop, located at 1730 Highway 10 in Gibbon, NE. The spill consists of approximately 3 gallons or more of a UN2809 mercury, which released from a metallic cylinder contained inside of a wooden crate. The driver stated he cannot get close enough to inspect the cylinder and provide a trade name as the substance is too dangerous, and they are not in possession of a BOL either. The spill is inside the trailer and has leaked out onto the asphalt beneath the trailer. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 teaspoon of Mercury product and .5-gallon motor oil was released to trailer and asphalt due to load shift. The waste, PPE and impacted absorbents were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums and Mercury waste was placed in a 5-gallon poly before it was placed in a (1) 35-gallon poly drum. The waste is staged for TSDF to pick up.

item.title: Report E-2024120199
item.description:
Report E-2024120199

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-12T12:24:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-25
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EnviroServe was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two areas measuring approximately 3ft-by-3ft of the trailer floor and 8ft-by-6ft of the concrete lot due to a puncture to one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. EnviroServe deployed granular absorbents to the areas and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

Report E-2024120209

  • City: GREENWOOD

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately a half (.5) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncturing the pail. The material was Ultra 7000 U7209. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120069
item.description:
Report E-2024120069

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-12T12:24:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 17:36 PM ET, NBM contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Bessemer, AL. The spill consists of approximately half a gallon of Carboguard 635 Part A, which released from 25-gallon metal pails due to a forklift blade puncturing the containers prior to arrival, impacting the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they cleaned the spill with absorbents and place the contents into 155-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.
